metadata.title: CVE-2022-45061 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in Python before 3.11.1. An unnecessary quadratic algorithm exists in one path when processing some inputs to the IDNA (RFC 3490) decoder, such that a crafted, unreasonably long name being presented to the decoder could lead to a CPU denial of service. Hostnames are often supplied by remote servers that could be controlled by a malicious actor; in such a scenario, they could trigger excessive CPU consumption on the client attempting to make use of an attacker-supplied supposed hostname. For example, the attack payload could be placed in the Location header of an HTTP response with status code 302. A fix is planned in 3.11.1, 3.10.9, 3.9.16, 3.8.16, and 3.7.16.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-45061` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python3.10 - 3.10.7-1ubuntu0.2
libpython3.10 - 3.10.7-1ubuntu0.2
libpython3.10-minimal - 3.10.7-1ubuntu0.2
libpython3.10-stdlib - 3.10.7-1ubuntu0.2
libpython3.10-testsuite - 3.10.7-1ubuntu0.2
python3.10 - 3.10.7-1ubuntu0.2
python3.10-examples - 3.10.7-1ubuntu0.2
python3.10-full - 3.10.7-1ubuntu0.2
python3.10-minimal - 3.10.7-1ubuntu0.2
python3.10-nopie - 3.10.7-1ubuntu0.2
python3.10-venv - 3.10.7-1ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in kinetic is affected and may need fixing.
python3.10 package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.10.7-1ubuntu0.2').
python3.11 package in kinetic is affected and needs fixing.
